role.descr: entity being removed // exon, gene, chromosomal region, cell //

example.text: Alternative mRNA splicing in the coding region (encoded by exons 3-12) generates transcripts which delete exons 8 (75 nt), 7+8 (156 nt) or 8+9 (168 nt) and that encode distinct protein isoforms (delta25, delta52 and delta56 aa, respectively).

example.text: The GATA-4 mutants that delete the N-terminal region and the first zinc finger (242 8211; 443) were able to synergize with MEF2A (Figure 6A).

example.text: The reporter plasmids contained a shorter fragment of the ErbB-2 promoter with a functional (D: ErbB-2: S) or mutated ZONAB-binding site (D: ErbB-2: S-D, deleted; ErbB-2: S-A, substitution of the inverted CCAAT box).

example.text: Thus, this granule enzyme is required for the unique effects of Leu-Leu-OMe and may provide a target for the development of other immunotherapeutic agents designed to delete cytotoxic lymphocyte responses.
example.arg: the development of other immunotherapeutic agents

example.text: Appropriate progenitor strains can now be constructed to delete virtually any chromosomal region by utilizing an extensive collection of lines containing single P element insertions throughout the Drosophila genome.

example.text: Recent experiments have provided direct evidence that antigen-loaded immature DCs silence T cells either by deleting them or by expanding regulatory T cells.
